fields.text: Why do you think you should budget?
fields.text_en: Why do you think you should budget?
fields.a: To help avoid spending more than you earn.
fields.a_en: To help avoid spending more than you earn.
fields.b: To know what your monthly expenses are.
fields.b_en: To know what your monthly expenses are.

fields.text: How much do you think you can save each month?
fields.text_en: How much do you think you can save each month?
fields.a: Zero - my debts are too high or I just don’t think I make enough to save any money
fields.a_en: Zero - my debts are too high or I just don’t think I make enough to save any money,.
fields.b: $25 a month as an experiment to start
fields.b_en: $25 a month as an experiment to start
fields.c: 10% of my income - I have a financial goal that I want to meet
fields.c_en: 10% of my income - I have a financial goal that I want to meet

fields.text: How do you feel about debt?
fields.text_en: How do you feel about debt?
fields.a: I would like to understand it better
fields.a_en: I would like to understand it better
fields.b: I think it is easy to manage with some discipline
fields.b_en: I think it is easy to manage with some discipline
fields.c: I think it should only be used for emergencies
fields.c_en: I think it should only be used for emergencies

fields.text: Claire really likes going to the movies, and is building her budget. Should she:
fields.text_en: Claire really likes going to the movies, and is building her budget. Should she:
fields.a: Ignore this while she builds her budget
fields.a_en: Ignore this while she builds her budget
fields.b: Budget for it because she knows she is going to go to the movies anyways
fields.b_en: Budget for it because she knows she is going to go to the movies anyways
fields.c: Find a new hobby that costs less
fields.c_en: Find a new hobby that costs less

fields.text: If you have a credit card with a $2,000 dollar balance, and you pay $40 a month, how long you think it would take for you to pay it off?
fields.text_en: If you have a credit card with a $2,000 dollar balance, and you pay $40 a month, how long you think it would take for you to pay it off?

fields.text: Lily wants to start investing. She generally doesn’t like risky stuff in life. She is presented with an investment opportunity that in the past has paid out over 20% a year. What should she do?
fields.text_en: Lily wants to start investing. She generally doesn’t like risky stuff in life. She is presented with an investment opportunity that in the past has paid out over 20% a year. What should she do?
fields.b: Only invest half her savings to see what happens
fields.b_en: Only invest half her savings to see what happens
fields.c: Sit down with an advisor and look at all of her options
fields.c_en: Sit down with an advisor and look at all of her options

fields.text: What is the most important thing to consider when creating your budget?
fields.text_en: What is the most important thing to consider when creating your budget?
fields.a: To be realistic about your spending habits
fields.a_en: To be realistic about your spending habits

fields.text: What is most important about saving?
fields.text_en: What is most important about saving?
fields.c: To save for a specific purpose - like to buy a new car
fields.c_en: To save for a specific purpose - like to buy a new car

fields.b: Set a saving goal in the FLY app
fields.b_en: Set a saving goal in the FLY app
fields.c: Check out some online resources for budgeting
fields.c_en: Check out some online resources for budgeting

fields.text: Megan really wants a new iPhone. What should she do?
fields.text_en: Megan really wants a new iPhone. What should she do?
fields.a: Save each month until she has enough
fields.a_en: Save each month until she has enough
fields.b: Wait a few months without saving and see what happens
fields.b_en: Wait a few months without saving and see what happens
fields.c: Pay for it with a credit card and pay it off later
fields.c_en: Pay for it with a credit card and pay it off later

fields.text: John started a great new job a few months ago and wants to move out on his own. What should he do?
fields.text_en: John started a great new job a few months ago and wants to move out on his own. What should he do?
fields.a: Figure out what he can afford after figuring out his expenses
fields.a_en: Figure out what he can afford after figuring out his expenses
fields.b: Move out to the cheapest place he can find
fields.b_en: Move out to the cheapest place he can find
fields.c: Stay at home so he can have more money to spend on stuff
fields.c_en: Stay at home so he can have more money to spend on stuff

fields.text: David really wants to start saving for a new car, but isn’t sure where to start.
fields.text_en: David really wants to start saving for a new car, but isn’t sure where to start.
fields.a: He can build saving for a car into his budget
fields.a_en: He can build saving for a car into his budget
fields.b: He can wait a few months and then think about it again
fields.b_en: He can wait a few months and then think about it again
fields.c: David should give up on buying a new car
fields.c_en: David should give up on buying a new car

fields.text: Why is having good credit important?
fields.text_en: Why is having good credit important?
fields.a: It is your reputation with lenders
fields.a_en: It is your reputation with lenders
fields.b: You’ll never know when you need it
fields.b_en: You’ll never know when you need it
fields.c: It helps determine how much you can borrow
fields.c_en: It helps determine how much you can borrow

fields.text: Pick your favourite way to manage your credit:
fields.text_en: Pick your favourite way to manage your credit:
fields.a: Keeping a low balance by not spending too much on credit
fields.a_en: Keeping a low balance by not spending too much on credit
fields.c: Using little or no credit at all
fields.c_en: Using little or no credit at all

fields.text: What will you do next to better manage your credit?
fields.text_en: What will you do next to better manage your credit?
fields.b: Review my existing credit and try to understand it better
fields.b_en: Review my existing credit and try to understand it better
fields.c: Make a plan to pay back my debt
fields.c_en: Make a plan to pay back my debt

fields.text: Lucy has heard a lot about credit and is worried about hers, since she had some late payments when she was younger. Where should she begin?
fields.text_en: Lucy has heard a lot about credit and is worried about hers, since she had some late payments when she was younger. Where should she begin?
fields.a: She should call her credit card company
fields.a_en: She should call her credit card company
fields.b: Make an appointment at her credit union
fields.b_en: Make an appointment at her credit union
fields.c: Go online to a provider like Equifax and get her credit score
fields.c_en: Go online to a provider like Equifax and get her credit score

fields.text: John has a credit card payment of $10.00 due in 3 days. What should he do?
fields.text_en: John has a credit card payment of $10.00 due in 3 days. What should he do?
fields.a: Ignore it until next month - the bank won’t care about $10.00
fields.a_en: Ignore it until next month - the bank won’t care about $10.00
fields.b: Make at least the minimum payment
fields.b_en: Make at least the minimum payment
fields.c: Wait a couple of weeks and then ask the bank if he needs to pay it since it is so low
fields.c_en: Wait a couple of weeks and then ask the bank if he needs to pay it since it is so low

fields.text: Cindy wants to get a mortgage someday and has been really good about saving up a down payment for a house. She pays all of her bills on time and has a $0 balance on her credit cards. Cindy doesn’t make very much money, so...
fields.text_en: Cindy wants to get a mortgage someday and has been really good about saving up a down payment for a house. She pays all of her bills on time and has a $0 balance on her credit cards. Cindy doesn’t make very much money, so...
fields.a: Cindy must have poor credit because she doesn’t make much money
fields.a_en: Cindy must have poor credit because she doesn’t make much money
fields.b: It sounds like Cindy has been doing all the right things
fields.b_en: It sounds like Cindy has been doing all the right things
fields.c: Cindy should hold off on any big decisions
fields.c_en: Cindy should hold off on any big decisions
